intro: Medinilla lagunae, commonly known as the Guanica medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Medinilla lagunae is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
